9. ANNUAL LEAVE
The Employee is entitled to annual leave (including weekly rest days), or a proportional entitlement based on time worked, in accordance with the Employment and Labour Relations Act.

11. MATERNITY / PATERNITY LEAVE
In accordance with the Employment and Labour Relations Act, maternity leave shall be granted to female employees and paternity leave to male employees.

12. APPLICATION OF EMPLOYMENT LAW AND REGULATIONS
This employment shall be governed by the Employment and Labour Relations Act, 2004 and its amendments, as well as applicable company rules, internal policies, and procedures.

13. TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT
Termination of employment shall follow the notice periods below:
• Seven (7) days if notice is given within the first month of employment
• Four (4) days if the employee is employed on a daily or weekly arrangement
• Twenty-eight (28) days if the employee is employed on a monthly basis
Failure to comply with this procedure may result in compensation to the affected party.

14. DISCIPLINE AND WORK ETHICS
The Employee shall be required to follow the company’s ethics, procedures, and guidelines. Violation of rules may result in disciplinary action.

15. CONFIDENTIALITY OF EMPLOYER INFORMATION
The Employee shall not disclose any confidential information of the Employer without written permission, even after leaving employment.

16. EMPLOYMENT DISPUTES
Any employment dispute shall first be handled through discussion. If unresolved, it shall be referred to the Commission for Mediation and Arbitration (CMA) in accordance with the law.
